member.name: T:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.ResultOptions
member.summary:
Defines the various ways a JsonPath query can deal with duplicate paths and order of results.
This enumeration has a FlagsAttribute attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.ResultOptions.Path
member.summary: This bit indicates that paths are required and is automatically set when required, e.g. if NoDups is set.

member.name: F:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.ResultOptions.NoDups
member.summary: Remove items from results that correspond to the same path.

member.name: F:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.ResultOptions.Sort
member.summary: Sort results by path.

member.name: T:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.JsonPath
member.summary: Represents a JsonPath expression.
member.remarks: A JsonPath may own references to some objects. It should be disposed to ensure that these objects are properly disposed.

member.name: M:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.JsonPath.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a JSONPath string into a JsonPath.

member.name: M:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.JsonPath.Select(System.Text.Json.JsonElement,JsonCons.JsonPathLib.ResultOptions)
member.summary: Selects values within the root value that match the JSONPath expression.
member.returns: A list of values within the root value that match the provided JSONPath expression

member.name: M:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.JsonPath.SelectPaths(System.Text.Json.JsonElement,JsonCons.JsonPathLib.ResultOptions)
member.summary: Selects paths identifying the values within the root value that match the JSONPath expression.
member.returns: A list of identifying the values within the root value that match the provided JSONPath expression

member.name: M:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.JsonPath.SelectNodes(System.Text.Json.JsonElement,JsonCons.JsonPathLib.ResultOptions)
member.summary: Selects nodes that represent location-value pairs within the root value that match the JSONPath expression.
member.returns: A list of representing locations-value pairs within the root value that match the provided JSONPath expression

member.name: M:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.JsonPath.Dispose
member.summary: Releases the resources used by this JsonPath instance.

member.name: T:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.JsonPathNode
member.summary: Represents a specific location-value pair within a root JSON value.

member.name: P:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.JsonPathNode.Path
member.summary: Gets the location of this value within a root JSON value.

member.name: P:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.JsonPathNode.Value
member.summary: Gets the value

member.name: T:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.PathComponentKind
member.summary: Specifies the type of a path component.

member.name: T:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.PathComponent
member.summary: Represents a component of a .

member.name: P:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.PathComponent.ComponentKind
member.summary: Gets the type of the component.

member.name: M:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.PathComponent.GetName
member.summary: Gets the value of the component as a name.

member.name: M:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.PathComponent.GetIndex
member.summary: Gets the value of the component as an index.

member.name: T:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.NormalizedPath
member.summary: Represents the location of a specific JSON value within a root JSON value.

member.name: M:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.NormalizedPath.#ctor(JsonCons.JsonPathLib.PathComponent)
member.summary: Constructs a normalized path from the last path component.

member.name: P:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.NormalizedPath.Last
member.summary: Gets the last component of the normalized path.

member.name: M:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.NormalizedPath.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the components of the normalized path.

member.name: M:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.NormalizedPath.ToString
member.summary: Gets a string representation for the normalized path. The string will have the form $['aName']['anotherName'][anIndex] with any single quote characters appearing in names escaped with a backslash.

member.name: M:JsonCons.JsonPathLib.NormalizedPath.ToJsonPointer
member.summary: Gets a JSON Pointer representation for the normalized path. The string will have the form /aName/anotherName/anIndex with any '~' and '/' characters appearing in names escaped as per the specification.
